nl.tudelft.jpacman.level

Class MapParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.jpacman.level.MapParser

  • public class MapParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates new Levels from text representations.

      Creates a new map parser.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapParser

        public MapParser(LevelFactory levelFactory,
                 BoardFactory boardFactory)
        Creates a new map parser.
        Parameters:
        levelFactory - The factory providing the NPC objects and the level.
        boardFactory - The factory providing the Square objects and the board.

    • Method Detail

      • parseMap

        public AILevel parseMap(char[][] map)
        Parses the text representation of the board into an actual level.
        • Supported characters:
        • ' ' (space) an empty square.
        • '#' (bracket) a wall.
        • '.' (period) a square with a pellet.
        • 'P' (capital P) a starting square for players.
        • 'G' (capital G) a square with a ghost.
        Parameters:
        map - The text representation of the board, with map[x][y] representing the square at position x,y.
        Returns:
        The level as represented by this text.

      • parseMap

        public AILevel parseMap(java.util.List<java.lang.String> text)
        Parses the list of strings into a 2-dimensional character array and passes it on to parseMap(char[][]).
        Parameters:
        text - The plain text, with every entry in the list being a equally sized row of squares on the board and the first element being the top row.
        Returns:
        The level as represented by the text.
        Throws:
        PacmanConfigurationException - If text lines are not properly formatted.

      • parseMap

        public AILevel parseMap(java.io.InputStream source)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Parses the provided input stream as a character stream and passes it result to parseMap(List).
        Parameters:
        source - The input stream that will be read.
        Returns:
        The parsed level as represented by the text on the input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the source could not be read.
